ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: KARUNYAVARSHAM STARTED ON 10TH APRIL, 2011 BY SERVING MEALS TO 100 PATIENTS IN GOVT MEDICAL COLLEGE HOSPITAL, ERNAKULAM, KALAMASSERY AND SUBSEQUENTLY REGISTERED WITH THE SUB REGISTRAR, THRIKKAKA DURING DECEMBER 2013. NOW WE HAVE BEEN SERVING FOOD TO MORE THAN 300 PATIENTS AND THEIR BYSTANDERS IN THE SAME HOSPIT FROM MONDAY TO SATURDAY AND TWO MEALS ON SUNDAYS. WE ARE PLANNING TO SERVE THREE MEALS EVERY DAY WITH NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO WOMEN AND CHILDREN. WE ARE ALSO PROVING AMBULANCE, LAB TEST CHARGES, MEDICINE CHARGES TO THE POOREST OF THE POOR PEOPLE. WE ARE ALSO RUNNING A FAMILY CONSELLING CENTRE, AT PALARIVATTOM, ERNAKULAM. IT IS MEANT FOR FAMILY, CHILDREN, INDIVIDUALS ETC. WE HAVE SUPPLIED FOOD PACKETS TO THE FAMILIES WHERE THEIR BREAD WINNER IS BED RIDDEN. we ARE ALSO RUNNING A PALLIATIVE HOME CARE SERVICE IT HELPS THE PATIENTS FOR THEIR NURSING NEEDS. WE ARE ALSO PROVING SUPPORTING EQUIPMENTS SUCH AS AIR BED, WHEEL CHAIR ETC TO THE BED RIDDEN PATIENTS.

ngoList.address: Kathakali School Society Centre for the Performing Arts and Culture Cheruthuruthy Thrissur-679531 Kerala
ngoList.title: Kathakali School
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Kathakali School, a centre for performing arts and culture is situated in Cheruthuruthy, Kerala, India since 1990. It is the unified effort of a group of the alumni of Kerala Kalamandalam led by Kalamandalam Gopalakrishnan. The Kathakali School staff are highly qualified and eminent performers. We are primarily a teaching institution and the school concentrates on the classical performing arts of Kerala, Kathakali, Mohiniyattam and Theyyam along with several folk and martial arts forms like Kalaripayattu. Kathakali School has performed in almost every continents. In India the school has conducted a number of programmes and workshops for Government and Private Organizations at all major Indian cities. The main workshops were conducted at Bangalore, Mumbai and Hyderabad at various times for CCRT, Govt of India. The Kendra Sangeetha Nataka Academy has also conducted workshops with the school. Kathakali School usually participates in partnership with Kerala Tourism at several places in India. We are also participants in the Govt. of India Cultural Exchange programmes with schools abroad. The south and north zone cultural centres frequently invite Kathakali School for workshops and performances. We feel we have shared in the efforts to preserve and propagate the ancient art forms that define Kerala.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Kerala Educational Development and Employment Society (KEDES) established in 1983 aims to reduce poverty by investing in the development of human capital with the aim of building skills and making knowledge available to all members of civil society for longterm sustainable development.KEDES encourages, and assists villagers to set up rural and small industries under the Micro & Small Industries Programme of the Govt. of India so as to give relief to the poor by providing full-time or part-time employment after imparting necessary training and ensure fair and reasonable wages. The emphais of KEDES is in organising vocationa, skill based training, ICT controlled education/online education that are employment oriented apart from providing general awareness for inclusive growth. In this respect CAPART, of the Ministry of Rural Development, Govt. of India had assessed the functioning of KEDES in 2008 and published its success stories. This is the first in Kerala and 52nd in the country since the inception of CAPART in 1986.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Kerala Statistical Institute (KSI) was established in December 1977 as a professional, non-commercial organization by a group of experts in statistics, economics, management and education. Since its inception, the Institute has carried out projects funded or supported by Government of India, Government of Kerala, renowned institutions like the Centre for Development Studies (CDS) and international agencies. KSI has proven capabilities and is fully geared to undertake major project assignments in an integrated basis from planning to analysis to, report writing as per pre-assigned time frame with an eye on qualitative aspects. The Institute has a live panel of experienced field supervisors and well trained investigators (male / female) located in all districts of the State and in neighbouring States. The panel consists of graduates / post-graduates. Most of the projects handled by KSI involved collection of data from a large number of households and non-household establishments, their processing and analysis. KSI has developed professional expertise geared to attend to large scale data processing and analysis needs of governmental and non-governmental organisations. In the field of data base management the Institute has developed competence to develop built-in data entry programmes as a prelude to the process of data entry and take up validation of data to ensure completeness and consistency. The following are some of the major achievements of KSI. â€¢ Need Assessment Study of Older Population in Kerala. Funded by United Nations Fund for Population Activities (UNFPA) through the Department of Health Services. Government of Kerala 2005. â€¢ Household Savings, Investments and Indebtedness in Kerala. Funded by Science, Technology and Environment Department, Government of Kerala 2003-04. â€¢ Endline Survey of ICDS III in Kerala funded by World Bank through Government of India, 2006. â€¢ Census of Computer / IT training institutions in Kerala funded by Kerala State Information Technology Mission, Government of Kerala, 2007. â€¢ Construction of a Forecasting Model for Coconut Oil Prices in India funded by Coconut Development Board, Government of India, 2007. â€¢ Field Survey on Migration in Kerala (international and internal including return migration, replacement migration) for the year 1998, 2000, 2001, 2003, 2007, 2008 and 2009. Funded by Centre for Development Studies. â€¢ Conversion of Paddy Land in Kerala, 1992- 1994 Funded by STED. â€¢ A unique study on the quality of living in 10 localities in Kerala was carried out in 1979-82. This was repeated at approximate intervals of 5 years in the same localities. â€¢ Impact of surplus land allotment in Kerala,1993- 94 Funded by Ministry of Rural Areas and Employment, Government of India. â€¢ Gender Inequality in Intra - Household Consumption Expenditure - Development of Methodology. Funded by Central Statistical Organisation 2004. â€¢ Morbidity in Kerala â€“Incidence, Prevalence and Associates. Funded by Centre for Development Studies 2003. â€¢ Household Cost of School Education in Kerala. Funded by Centre for Development Studies 2003. â€¢ Concurrent evaluation of various programmes like Integrated Rural Development Programmes, Indira Awaas Yojana, Million Wells Scheme (Kerala, Lakshadweep), Rural Development programmes (Tamil Nadu) and Impact Assessment of Watershed Development project (Karnataka). Funded by Ministry of Rural Areas and Employment, Government of India.

ngoList.ngoName: Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church Medical Mission Hospital
ngoList.address: MOSCMC Hospital Kolenchery P O Ernakulam Dist - 682 311 Kerala India
ngoList.title: Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church Medical Mission Hospital
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church Medical Mission was founded under the auspices of the Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church and was registered as a charitable institution under the Travancore Cochin Literary Scientific and Charitable Societies Registration Act XII of 1955 on 18.2.67. The mission has been rendering service to the public at large with the objective to engage in activities which will result in the development and upliftment of the rural areas and facilities around Kolenchery. The MOSC Medical Mission Hospital commenced providing services on 14th Sept. 1970 with 100 beds and now it has grown to a Medical College with 1100 beds with all preclinical, clinical and superspeciality departments. All activities of the hospital including the medical college are of charitable and philanthropic nature not involving any activity for profit. The hospital including the specialized departments cater to the needs of the public at large at a very subsidized rates for treatment, diagnostic services, dispensing medicines etc. We provide the following social and community services. â€¢ An amount of Rs. 3 lakhs per month is allotted for patients who are kept under teaching free cases. â€¢ The hospital set aside around Rs.200 lakhs a year under hospital free a/c for the Free Diabetic clinic, Free Ophthal treatment, Free ENT treatment, Free medical clinics at various community centres, Free Tuesday clinics and Concession on final bills of patients â€¢ Dept. of Community medicine operates 6 health centres providing outreach clinics, antenatal check up, immunization and blood sugar checking and providing health education. â€¢ We have set aside Rs. 200 lakhs every year to give scholarship for eligible students studying in our Medical College. â€¢ We are giving free dialysis to 20 patients in our hospital. Annual expense w/off in this account amount to Rs. 29 lakhs (approx.) â€¢ One of our major achievements is that we provide free De-addiction treatment with the financial support of MSJE, Govt. of India.
